intro: Polygala heliostigma, commonly known as the sun mimic or golden bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy species well adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. The plant's unique morphology and vibrant colors make it a notable addition to botanical gardens and native plant collections.
